solution_line_template: Niko will earn ${sock_cost} x {profit_percent}/100 = $<<{sock_cost}*{profit_percent}/100={profit_per_pair_first}>>{profit_per_pair_first} profit for each of the first four pairs of socks.
So, his total profit for the four pairs of socks will be ${profit_per_pair_first} x {num_first_pairs} = $<<{profit_per_pair_first}*{num_first_pairs}={total_profit_first}>>{total_profit_first}.
His total earnings for the 5 pairs of socks is ${profit_per_pair_second} x {num_second_pairs} = $<<{profit_per_pair_second}*{num_second_pairs}={total_profit_second}>>{total_profit_second}.
Therefore, his total profit will be ${total_profit_first} + ${total_profit_second} = $<<{total_profit_first}+{total_profit_second}={total_profit}>>{total_profit}.
